title-group.article-title: Till Death Do Us Unite: Texts, Tombs, and the Cultural History of Weddings in Middle-Period China (Eighth through Fourteenth Century)

permissions.copyright-statement: Copyright 2006 The Association of Asian Studies, Inc.

p.mixed-citation: his bibliographical essays, "When men sustain a specialized branch of learning, the branch of learning will transmit its books, and the books will maintain their proper classification. Though men may live or die, the learning will not perish, and though disasters may shake the world, the books will not be lost" (Tongzhi ll6l,p. 1804).
